CodecDevice::VideoDecoderParameters

CodecDevice::VideoDecoderParameters Struct Reference

#include <Apoxi/AddOns/CodecManager/CodecDevice.hpp>


Data Fields

UINT16 m_actual_height
UINT16 m_actual_width
UINT32 m_length_of_header_length_field
UINT32 m_length_of_length_field
UINT32 m_max_bit_rate
UINT16 m_quality_level

Detailed Description

Video decoder parameters passed to the decoder.
See also:
VideoDecoder::SetConfig

Field Documentation

UINT16 CodecDevice::VideoDecoderParameters::m_actual_height
 

Height of the compressed video frame. This parameter is only used if there is no config stream, i.e. if the config_stream parameter in VideoDecoder::SetConfig is 0. Otherwise this parameter is ignored by the decoder since this information is retrieved by the decoder from the config stream.

UINT16 CodecDevice::VideoDecoderParameters::m_actual_width
 

Width of the compressed video frame. This parameter is only used if there is no config stream, i.e. if the config_stream parameter in VideoDecoder::SetConfig is 0. Otherwise this parameter is ignored by the decoder since this information is retrieved by the decoder from the config stream.

UINT32 CodecDevice::VideoDecoderParameters::m_length_of_header_length_field
 

Length (in bytes) required to represent header length. This is useful only if the stream is encoded in 3GPP format. For H.264 decoder only.

UINT32 CodecDevice::VideoDecoderParameters::m_length_of_length_field
 

Length (in bytes) of NAL length field present in compressed frame data. The compressed video frame contains length of each NAL unit followed by NAL data. This is useful only if the stream is encoded in 3GPP format. For H.264 decoder only.

UINT32 CodecDevice::VideoDecoderParameters::m_max_bit_rate
 

Maximum bit rate (in bits/sec). If this info is not available this value shall be set to 0.

UINT16 CodecDevice::VideoDecoderParameters::m_quality_level
 

Quality level of the decoder. The greater this value, the better the quality. In general, in dependency of this value the post-processsing features (Deinterlacing, Deringing & Deblocking) are enabled/disabled. 0 corresponds to default settings. If the value is greater than the maximum supported quality level (which can be retrieved via CodecManager::GetVideoDecoderCapabilities), the maximum level is set.
